title: Drawing, "Male Head Facing Left, Sulla", 1930–32
description: The source of the chiseled appearance of the head is ancient Roman sculpture; the features look carved rather than drawn. The dark line depicting the upper lip of the closed mouth, along with the furrowed forehead and thickly applied crayon throughout, produce a confident, concerned expression. Sulla appears in capitals just above the left shoulder.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Male Head Facing Left, Sulla", 1930–32.
1930–32. China crayon. Gift of Ellen Gustav Jensen. 1956-47-26.
